Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it is initializing the array with the size of 'end - 1' instead of 'end - start'. This will cause an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the 'start' is greater than 1. Also, it will not return the correct number of elements if 'start' is not 1. Generated Test cases 1-6 (6/17) should pass the buggy code as they have 'start' as 1. The rest of the test cases should fail the buggy code as they have 'start' greater than 1.
